DOC.brief_summary: The purpose is to investigate whether a simple additional treatment applied during colonoscopy (called 'soft' coagulation) can reduce the risk of recurrence of polyp at the area where the polyp was removed. After a large polyp is removed it is known that there is a 20% chance that a small recurrence of polyp occurs at the site of removal can occur within 5 months of the polyp being removed. This in theory will burn off tiny polyp tissue, which is usually not visible to the naked eye. This additional treatment may possibly reduce the risk of polyp recurrence.
DOC.brief_title: Soft Coagulation for the Prevention of Adenoma Recurrence
DOC.criteria: Referred for removal of a colonic polyps >20mm Younger than 18 years of age Highly dependant on medical care Women who are pregnant or may be pregnant.
